alert.note: Alert for Lake; Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 04 at 9:04AM EDT until June 06 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Melbourne FL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .Increasing northeast winds and high astronomical tides will allow the Saint Johns River at Astor to continue a rise through Action Stage today, and levels are forecast to reach Minor Flood Stage (2.3 ft) either this evening or into late tonight. River levels are then forecast to hover around or potentially just above Minor Flood Stage through early this week, before falling back to Action Stage by mid-week. For the St. Johns River...including Astor...Minor flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM EDT. && ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St Johns River Near Astor. * WHEN...From this evening to Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 2.3 feet, Minor flooding of low lying streets and yards north of Fox Road on Lake County side of Astor, and from River Road northward on Volusia side of river. Water begins to cover docks at South Moon Fish Camp. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 2.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 2.3 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday night. - Flood stage is 2.3 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 am) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Thu Fri St Johns River Astor 2.3 2.2 Sun 8 am 2.3 2.3 2.2 2.0 1.7 &&
